reviewText:
Early Access Review

The devs have abandoned the game and left it in an unplayable state. There's no content and no goal. You can't progress your character and combat isn't functional.
It hasn't been updated since March at the time of this writing and there's been no word about any further updates from the devs since August.
Don't fall for this scam.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt could be a game it ever gets finished, but I doubt that will happen.
voteText: 14 of 21 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf old Rogue-like games with the 1989/90's graybrick Gameboy graphics, tickle you? A rosy reminder of fueled days with milk and cookies from yer youth? SQG could be what you are looking for. Important to note SilverQuest: Gaiden is in Early Access and nowhere as fleshed out as it should be. What grabbed me was its aim to be a very moddable game which allows the adding and expanding of what you like by the user. The current price IMHO is an invesment into what will hopefully end up as a nice rogue-style game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe graphics made my eyes water as I played ear stinging notes on a digital Lyre for a couple of minutes,  read a few short books, then walked into  a creature of some description (that I could not describe) which caused a fatal error that crashed the game. I am very excited to follow the development of this game , as it shows a certain promise in regards to implimentation of small + cool details alongside an interesting aesthetic + promised modularity.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you're a kid of the 80's and consider retro-dungeon-crawlers to be your type of game you may very much like this tiny piece of software.

And oh my gosh, what fun it was to fiddle around with those graphic settings. 2-Bit, incoooming!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There is literally nothing in game now except monsters that do no damage and items that have no use, you can't even exit game normally. Ok, that's just early access and stuff. Dare i can write roguelike in python within 1 month including more features.
Guess how you can add content and edit it? Recode it. Just finish the devs job, have fun there.
Expecting them to add actual gameplay to game".
Recommending it for those who love they games in fetus pre-omega form."
